body_html:
@SsnL This depends on locking byte ranges, which I think is some kind of POSIX extension that is not guaranteed to work on NFS (or at least some older version of NFS). I really like the trick though 👍

I don't see how this trick can work around the issue that @teng-li describes here though, only how it ensures you can reuse the same file across multiple runs.

body:
@SsnL This depends on locking byte ranges, which I think is some kind of POSIX extension that is not guaranteed to work on NFS (or at least some older version of NFS). I really like the trick though :+1: 

I don't see how this trick can work around the issue that @teng-li describes here though, only how it ensures you can reuse the same file across multiple runs.
